page.title: 01RESUME OF THE AREA
page.content: This is a rural area consisting mainly of arable farms with the occasional dairy herd.It is crossed from SW to NE by the B1111 road to the NW of which lies one of the few remaining wet fens, recently acquired by the Suffolk Trust for Nature Conservation. There are two villages in the area: {Market Weston} 40 metres above sea level; population 223 at 198l Census, l8l adults on l985 Electoral Register. Church, village hall, village shop with Post Office. {Barningham} 30-40 metres above sea level; population 833 at l98l Census, 730 adults on l985 Electoral Register. Church, village hall, village shop with Post Office. In the W, the area touches Coney Weston (its Church and Hall); in the NE, Hopton (its school, village hall and shop).
